intro: Hieracium articeps, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Hieracium articeps is an herbaceous perennial that spreads through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in certain environments.
